article:
An 'electrostatic separator' is a device for separating particles by mass in a
low energy charged beam.

It works on the principle of corona discharge, where two plates are placed close
together and high voltage is applied. this high voltage is used to separate the
ionized particles.

Usually these are used in power plants where the harmful gases coming out of the
chimneys are first treated using electrostatic separator. here the two
electrodes are oppositely charged, with a negative electrode the positive ions
gets attracted and thus results in a 'reddish' flame whereas the positive
electrode is used to treat the negatively charged ions resulting in a 'bluish
white' flame that is visible at nights.
